gamelogic
Class Board

java.lang.Object
  gamelogic.Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
julien Provides a model for the main game board. The board is responsible of localizing units, check that only one unit is present is on square, and propagating fire, move, and destroy events. The size of the grid is always 100x100 as this is one of the rules of the games.

Constructor Summary
Board()
          Creates a new empty board of size 100x100.

setMap

public void setMap(Map m)
Associate the map with the board.

Parameters:
m -

getMap

public Map getMap()
Returns the map associated with this board.

Returns:
The map of the board

addUnit

public void addUnit(Unit unit,
                    int x,
                    int y)
Adds an unit to to board at the given coordinates. Unlike setUnit() it also modify the unit's properties. It is useful for example with a newly created unit.

Parameters:
unit - The unit to assign to the board.
x - X position of the unit.
y - Y position of the unit.

getTerrainType

public int getTerrainType(Square s)
Returns the terrain type of the given square.

Parameters:
s - The current square.
Returns:

getTerrainType

public int getTerrainType(int x,
                          int y)
Returns the terrain type of the given square.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the current square
y - The Y coordinate of the current square
Returns:

addClient

public void addClient(BoardListener client)
Registers a new client to listen to events on the board. The events are fired once they are completely finished, so the clients must not modify the state of the board in their methods.

Parameters:
client - The client listener to add to the list.

removeClient

public void removeClient(BoardListener client)
Removes a client from the list. If it is present several times, removes it once.

Parameters:
client - The client listener to remove from the list.

getUnitAt

public Unit getUnitAt(int x,
                      int y)
Return the unit located at the given position. The unit is untouched.

Parameters:
x - X position of the unit.
y - Y position of the unit.
Returns:
Unit located at the given point.

getUnitAt

public Unit getUnitAt(Square loc)
Return the unit located at the given position. The unit is untouched.

Parameters:
loc - Position of the unit.
Returns:
Unit located at the given point.

setUnitAt

public void setUnitAt(int x,
                      int y,
                      Unit unit)
Sets the given square containing the given unit. The unit is untouched. You have to modify the coordinates of the unit each time you use this method.

Parameters:
x - X position of the unit.
y - Y position of the unit.
unit - Unit to place in the given coordinates.

setUnitAt

public void setUnitAt(Square pos,
                      Unit unit)
Sets the given square containing the given unit. The unit is untouched. You have to modify the coordinates of the unit each time you use this method.

Parameters:
pos - Position of the unit.
unit - Unit to place in the given coordinates.

notifyMove

public void notifyMove(Square pos,
                       java.util.Vector<Square> path,
                       BoardListener unitClient)
Notify the game client of a move.

Parameters:
pos - The current position of the unit
path - The movement to go to the goal
unitClient - The listener who receive the move event

notifyShot

public void notifyShot(Square source,
                       Square dest,
                       BoardListener unitClient)
Notify the game of a shoot

Parameters:
source - The square where the rocket come from
dest - The square where the rocket going to
unitClient - The listener who receive the move event

notifyFly

public void notifyFly(Square source,
                      Square dest,
                      BoardListener unitClient)
Parameters:
source - The square where the flying unit come from
dest - The square where the flying unit going to
unitClient - The listener who receive the move event

notifyDestroy

public void notifyDestroy(Square dest,
                          BoardListener unitClient)
Notify a destruction of a unit to the boardlistener

Parameters:
dest - The position of the destroyed unit
unitClient - The listener who receive the move event

newTurn

public void newTurn()
Declares a new turn. Resets all turn-dependent properties of units such as moves and shots.
